head.supplied: ¶ [Again submits an estimate for his Department for the new financial year.] ¶ On 2 September Casey instructed: 'There are other letters I have seen them, one particularly when The Baron von Mueller ...

div.p: No. 14805, unit 23, VPRS 227/P inward correspondence register, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
Letter not found; item is a register entry only, of a letter dated 14 July 1872. See also M to J. Casey, 9 July 1872, and M to J. Casey, 4 September 1872 (in this edition as 72-09-04a).
[Again submits an estimate for his Department for the new financial year.]
On 2 September Casey instructed: 'There are other letters I have seen them, one particularly when The Baron von Mueller says he can make no other alteration than those originally submitted. Get them for me today'. TheAccountant, Board of Land and Works, E. Agg, stated on the same day: 'I have not the letters referred to in as much as I sent some time since all the Baron's letters on the subject of the estimates, to the Asst Commr in order that he might be in a position to prepare report ordered by the President'. The Assistant Commissioner of Crown Lands and Survey, C. Hodgkinson, reported on 2 September: 'There is a letter in which Baron Von Mueller states his inability to make any further alteration, and what was submitted by me to the Honble The Commissioner of L & S and noted by him'. After a further search for the letter in Hodgkinson's room and in Agg's room, Agg noted on 3 September: 'The letter in question viz F14805 was written by the Baron on the 16th July and Registered & handed to me on the 18th, when I recollect stating to Mr Vance that inasmuch as Mr Lewis wrote the letter to which the Baron's was an answer, I could have nothing to do with it unless officially referred to me; I accordingly sent the documents to the Asst Commr — By the Asst Commissioners of the 2nd Inst it appears that he submitted the letter to the President after obtaining it from me, since which I have not seen the document'. Hodgkinson noted on 6 September, 'I think it must have been sent to Cabinet with other papers' (H72/19018, unit 750, VPRS 44, Public Record Office, Victoria).
